DOC.brief_summary: The investigator aim evaluate tramadol-sparing effect intravenous ( IV ) ibuprofen patient undergo percutaneous nephrolithotomy ( PCNL ) .
DOC.detailed_description: Eighty patient undergo PCNL randomize intravenous paracetamol ( n=40 ) intravenous ibuprofen ( n=40 ) group . Patients receive 100 mL physiologic saline 1 g IV paracetamol 800 mg IV ibuprofen 30 minute end operation postoperatively 6 , 12 18 hour PCNL paracetamol ibuprofen group , respectively . Patients group receive intravenous tramadol patient control analgesia device ( PCA ) . The visual analog scale ( VAS ) use evaluate pain intensity score postoperative period . Total tramadol consumption , mean VAS score 1 , 8 24 hour , demographic variable , operative variable , side effect record .
DOC.criteria: Study include 80 patient American Society Anesthesiologists ( ASA ) physical status III age 1870 year schedule percutaneous nephrolithotomy operation . chronic pain , psychiatric disease , renal dysfunction , allergy nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drug , history drug addiction , pregnancy , inability use patient control analgesia ( PCA ) device .
